metadata.title: CVE-2018-9363 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the hidp_process_report in bluetooth, there is an integer overflow. Thiscould lead to an out of bounds write with no additional executionprivileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID: A-65853588References: Upstream kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-39-generic - 4.15.0-39.42
linux-image-4.15.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-39.42
linux-image-4.15.0-39-lowlatency - 4.15.0-39.42
linux-image-4.15.0-39-snapdragon - 4.15.0-39.42
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-39-generic - 4.15.0-39.42
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-39-lowlatency - 4.15.0-39.42
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1028-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1028.30
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-aws - 4.15.0-1027.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1031-azure - 4.15.0-1031.32
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1024-gcp - 4.15.0-1024.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1026-kvm - 4.15.0-1026.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1026-oem - 4.15.0-1026.31
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-39.42').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1028.30').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.27').
linux-hwe package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.32').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1024.25').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.26').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.31').
